captions.text: You see that?! I almost died! Wheww!
Ha ha! That would have really stunk wouldn't it?
I mean I just got here!

Listen, there's something I need to
tell you.
Get out of the city there's giant monsters!
It's headed straight for the city and people are gonna die!!!
Leave now before it's too late!!
You don't want me to wait for you to get here first?
For God's sake, stop talking and just go!
Oh, and take our son with you!

Whatever you do, do not leave him with a
stranger. That's just weird!

Okay, I will. Thank you for letting me know.
Goodbye!!
The arrogance of man is thinking nature is in their control
and not the other way around.
Are you sure there's nothing we can do?
Maybe nuke the creatures before they reach a major city?

Maybe power down the facilities these
monsters feed off of?
You just wanna see giant monsters fight, don't you?
Ok there's cat 5 kaiju in San Francisco, we've combined our memories and we're ready to fight.
The boat's driving away with the bomb.

There's no way that boat got far enough
away in time!!
I was so worried but now everything's okay!
Be amazed, ladies and gentlemen, because we are clearly looking at the greatest hero to ever exist on this great earth.

Oh sure, when Godzilla destroys half the
city and kills the unstoppable threat
to save the world everyone cheers!

but when I do it, everyone gets all
grouchy and judgmental.
Hey, way to go Godzilla. You killed those awful creatures... that only wanted to breed.

you know who else wanted to procreate at
the expense of humanity??
Thank you guys for waiting, HISHE is back!
Start expecting more content from us, a lot more!
We're gonna be giving away a lot of cool stuff over there so you don't wanna miss it.
The first one is really cool. Links are in the description.
Hey Ford, you ever thought about how many times you've crossed paths with these giant creatures?
You're like some kind of mega-monster magnet!

comments.author: foxy the pirate fox

comments.text:
Thank you for the Man of Steel crossover! That movie was so spectacular and 
loaded with so many layers of depth, symbolism, and religious & 
mythological allegories that a lot of the airhead fans of the competition's 
superhero movies don't have the sophisticated eye to see the deeper subtext 
when watching Man of Steel. Instead, they went into MOS looking for reasons 
to hate it & bash it, so they reach for weak arguments like the amount of 
city destruction and not enough comedy. This is Superman for God's sake! 
This is modern day American mythology. It's not supposed to be funny or 
lighthearted. That stuff waters down the material and says both you & your 
audience don't take this seriously. To all you hipsters out there– Comedy 
in superhero works isn't brilliant; it just says you're so lazy & 
distracted that you have to have cheap laughs to keep your attention 
focused and that you can't even take this type of stuff serious for long 
enough to see the layered depth you have to mine the text for. Sorry to go 
on a rant like this, but I've been reading comics since the early 90s and 
I'm disturbed by the lighthearted direction I'm seeing the genre go. The 
last time we did that we got the Adam West Batman show and for many decades 
afterwards we asked ourselves, "What were we thinking?..."﻿
